results.creator_credit: Chris McCullough and Australian Broadcasting Corporation

Episode of Series “Journey into India”.

results.title: The Invention of the adolescent (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Patricia Watson, Cecily Burwash, Guy Glover and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: From the past, when distinctions between childhood and adulthood were not as finely drawn as they are today, this film traces the development of the adolescent and shows some of the real problems of this age. It notes that it was the defense of the young, the protection afforded by reformers and educators, that created the generation gap so evident today in Western society. What adolescents gained and lost from changing attitudes towards them is clearly illustrated in the film. (Awards: New York; La Plata; Tehran)

results.title: The Interview [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Craig Monahan, Bill Hughes, Film Finance Corporation Australia and Interview Films
results.brief_description: A haunting feature debut from Craig Monahan which explores the complex psychological exchange between Detective Sergeant John Steele (Tony Martin) and nervy suspected murderer Eddie Fleming (Hugo Weaving) during the hours of a claustrophobic police interrogation.The apparently ordinary Fleming is asleep in his apartment when his door is broken down and he is accused of nameless crimes. He is the only lead the tough, world weary Detective Sergeant Steele has and so begins a bewildering sequence of interviews where the crime and the many forces at work between the characters and their situation gradually becomes apparent. The nature of guilt, innocence and who or what to believe is rendered uncertain in this film as we are presented not with any concrete answers but with the fluidity of perception and the difficulties of defining truth. (Awards: Winner Best Original Screenplay, Best Film and Best Actor (Hugo Weaving) Australian Film Institute Awards, 1998)

results.title: The Island of Nevawuz
results.creator_credit: Paul Williams and Fable Films Productions
results.brief_description: Nevawuz is an idyllic and underdeveloped island in danger of corruption. J.B. Trumphorn, a corporate boss attempts to industrialize the island by using it’s natural source of oil. Aided by the King’s nephew his plan works, polluting the island as a result. Resistance to Trumphorn comes in the form of the young islander, Otto, and his dog Spot, who lead the islanders in a defence of Nevawuz. An instructive and entertaining video for children on the issue of pollution and industrialization. The video also includes “The True story of Ned Kelly” and “Ned Kelly’s dastardly dilemma”. All three tales are written and produced by Paul Williams.

results.title: The Incredible journey
results.creator_credit: Fletcher Markle, Walt Disney and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: A holidaying family leave their three pets: Bodger, a bull-terrior; Tao, a Siamese cat; and Luath, a Labrador retriever in charge of a family guest, Emile. When the guest goes off hunting but fails to inform the animals, the three pets begin an incredible journey, over 200 miles to reach their owners. With the majestic Canadian countryside as a backdrop, this film is based on the book by Sheila Burnford. Starring Emile Genest, John Drainie, Tommy Tweed and Sandra Algar.

results.title: The Irishman
results.creator_credit: Donald Crombie, Anthony Buckley and Forest Home Films
results.brief_description: Based on the novel of the same name by Elizabeth O’Connor. Set in Northern Queensland in the 1920’s, it is the story of a proud Irish Australian teamster and his family as they face the competition from motorised transport. This is the story of a family experiencing events which they cannot control in the face of progress and change. Stars Michael Craig, Simon Burke, Robin Nevin and Bryan Brown.

results.title: The Irish in Australia: Echo of a Distant Drum
results.creator_credit: Matthew Flanagan, Michael Balson, Richard Dennison and Orana Films
results.brief_description: One in three Australians have Irish origins - and this is reflected in the national character. The humour; the sense of self-mockery; ideals of fair play; the dislike of pomp and bombast; the celebration of noble failure; are all characteristics both Irish and Australian. The story of the Irish in Australia has been one of conflict, often echoing dramatic events in Ireland. It’s a history that has been potentially so divisive that it has been ignored. But it is the key to understanding why Australia has become the democratic nation that it is, and yet remains ambivalent on national issues.

results.title: The Incredible human machine
results.creator_credit: Irwin Rosten and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description: A journey through the wondrous inner world of the human body. Explore the fascinating, microscopic universe that exists within us all. How does the eye adjust in light? How do our muscles enable us to move? How does the eardrum process sound? With the help of sophisticated photographic techniques you are now able to discover the wonders of the internal human world.
